properties.name: Smoothy
properties.description: A Zuma clone to show how to orginize a project with behaviors.

events.comment:
Objects on the board:
- BoardBubble are bubbles that move on the gutter.
- BubbleQueue contain BoardBubble that are touching one to another.
- Gutter contain BubbleQueue
- Spawner create new BoardBubble in the gutter.

Objects for player actions:
- AimingBubble rotates according to how the player is aiming.
- PreviewBubble shows the next color.
- InsertedBubble handle the insertion animation.

A big part of the events is inside the Smoothy extension.
Most of the objects have dedicated behaviors:
- BoardBubble animate explosions.
- BubbleQueueBehavior contains bubbles bonded to each other. Each end of the queue has a FSM for the combo movement.
- GutterBehavior contains bubbles queues and push the queue at the beginning of the gutter.
- SpawnerBehavior generate bubbles to add in its gutter.
- InsertedBubbleBehavior animates bubble insertions by pushing leading bubbles from the same queue.

The "Curved movement" extension is used to move bubbles on a path.
The "Object stack" extension is used to keep track of the bubbles order.

Handle leaderboards.
To create a leaderboard, make sure your game is registered in Home > Profile > Games Dashboard and then, click on "Manage game" > Leaderboards. When a leaderboard is created, it should be available in the actions.
Allow to try and submit again in case of error.
Find which colors are still on the board because only these colors will be given to the player when he shoots.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ExtendedMath
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Additional math functions and constants as expressions and conditions.

- ToFixedString: Formats a number into a string with the specified number of decimal places
- ToFixed: (Deprecated) Formats a number to use the specified number of decimal places
- IsEven: Check if the number is even (divisible by 2)
- Deprecated ToFixed() because it does not show any trailing zeros for whole numbers. Prefer using ToFixedString() to set values in text objects.

eventsBasedObjects.description: A button that can be customized.
eventsBasedObjects.name: PanelSpriteButton

events.comment:
Create one background instance for of each state.
Only the instance for the current state is shown.
Place the label over the backgrounds.
Show the right background accordingly to the new state.

Children instances must be resized when the button size change:
- backgrounds for each state are resized to take the full dimensions of the button
- the label is put back at the center of the button

The scale is set back to 1 because it means that the parent instance has the same dimensions as the union of its children instances.

events.comment: States are explained in doStepPreEvents.
Tail state have precedence over head state.
Gutter push
Keep the same speed.
Keep the same speed.

Bubble queues have 2 finite state machines:
- one for the queue tail
- one for the queue head

As stated in the SetBubbleSpeed action, the tail state has precedence over the head state to choose the speed.

The states are the following:
- Idle, there is no combo animation
- JustSplit, the queue was split and the magnet check is not yet done or color don't match.
- WillMagnet, the queues are matching but they keep their current speed during a small delay.
- HitStop, the queues are stopping for a small amount of time to put emphasis to the animation.
- HitStopEnd, the end of the hit stop. The tailing queue start back at the previous impact speed.
- Rewinding, the leading queue is going backward until it reaches its tailing queue.
- RewindImpact, the queues are colliding, when combo are chained the tailing queue is given more and more speed at the impact.
- StopOrTaillingPush, change the speed before going back to the idle state.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: CurvedMovement
description: This extension allows to move objects on Bzier curve paths.
- Paths can be built dynamically or from predetermined paths in SVG format.
- A behavior moves objects in a given duration a bit like the Tween extension does.
- Another behavior moves objects using a speed and an acceleration.
- Expressions give access to the path trajectory values for more complex movements.
This extension can be used to:
- Move enemies that follow a pattern
A collection of [small examples](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://curved-movement) show how to use this extension.

eventsFunctions.description: Create a path from SVG commands, for instance "M 0,0 C 55,0 100,45 100,100". Commands are: M = Move, C = Curve, S = Smooth, L = Line. Lower case is for relative positions. The preferred way to build the commands is to use an external SVG editor like Inkscape.

eventsFunctions.name: MoveTo
eventsFunctions.sentence: Move _PARAM0_ to _PARAM6_ ; _PARAM7_ on the path: _PARAM2_ repeated _PARAM3_ times in _PARAM4_ seconds with _PARAM5_ easing

parameters: AngleBetweenPositions(Object.X(), Object.Y(), GetArgumentAsNumber("DestinationX"), Object.Y() + (GetArgumentAsNumber("DestinationY") - Object.Y()) / Object.Behavior::PathSpeedScaleY()) - AngleBetweenPositions(0, 0, Object.Behavior::PathEndX(),  Object.Behavior::PathEndY() / Object.Behavior::PathSpeedScaleY())

DistanceBetweenPositions(Object.X(), Object.Y(), GetArgumentAsNumber("DestinationX"), Object.Y() + (GetArgumentAsNumber("DestinationY") - Object.Y()) / Object.Behavior::PathSpeedScaleY()) / DistanceBetweenPositions(0, 0, Object.Behavior::PathEndX(), Object.Behavior::PathEndY() / Object.Behavior::PathSpeedScaleY()) / GetArgumentAsNumber("RepetitionCount")

events.comment: Update speed
Update the position on the path (the current length) with a Verlet integration.
It's useful to know which way to look at when the speed reached 0.

DistanceBetweenPositions(Object.X(), Object.Y(), GetArgumentAsNumber("DestinationX"), Object.Y() + (GetArgumentAsNumber("DestinationY") - Object.Y()) / Object.Behavior::PathSpeedScaleY()) / DistanceBetweenPositions(0, 0, Object.Behavior::PathEndX(), Object.Behavior::PathEndY() / Object.Behavior::PathSpeedScaleY()) / GetArgumentAsNumber("RepetitionCount")

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: FireBullet
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Fire bullets, manage ammo, reloading and overheating.
description: This extension allows objects to fire bullets.
- Firing multiple bullets at a time ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://fire-bullet))
A simple example shows how to make firing patterns ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://firing-patterns)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Fire bullets, manage ammo, reloading, and overheating.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: FireBullet

events.comment: Creators can use the "FireBullet" action multiple times in a frame and it will be counted as a single "shot".
Subtract 1 from ammo (if not unlimited ammo)
Increase heat (if needed)
Check if this caused overheat
Detect when reload is completed
Only reload the amount of ammo available

events.name: Reduce heat level (based on cooling rate)

eventsFunctions.description: Fire bullets toward an object.
eventsFunctions.name: FireTowardObject
eventsFunctions.sentence: Fire _PARAM4_ from _PARAM0_, at position _PARAM2_; _PARAM3_, toward _PARAM5_ with speed _PARAM6_ px/s

events.name: Calculate the trajectory angle and use the "Fire bullets" action

parameters.description: X position, where to create the bullet
parameters.name: XPosition

parameters.description: Y position, where to create the bullet
parameters.name: YPosition

parameters.description: Speed of the bullet, in pixels per second
parameters.name: Speed

eventsFunctions.description: Fire bullets toward a position.
eventsFunctions.name: FireTowardPosition
eventsFunctions.sentence: Fire _PARAM4_ from _PARAM0_, at position _PARAM2_; _PARAM3_, toward position _PARAM5_;_PARAM6_ with speed _PARAM7_ px/s

events.name: Calculate the trajectory angle and use the "Fire bullets" action

parameters.description: X position, where to create the bullet
parameters.name: XPosition

parameters.description: Y position, where to create the bullet
parameters.name: YPosition

parameters.description: Speed of the bullet, in pixels per second
parameters.name: Speed

eventsFunctions.description: Fire bullets in the direction of a given angle.
eventsFunctions.name: Fire
eventsFunctions.sentence: Fire _PARAM4_ from _PARAM0_, at position _PARAM2_; _PARAM3_, toward angle _PARAM5_ and speed _PARAM6_ px/s

events.comment: Move temp variable to the next angle a bullet will be sent

parameters.description: X position, where to create the bullet
parameters.name: XPosition

parameters.description: Y position, where to create the bullet
parameters.name: YPosition

parameters.description: Angle of the bullet, in degrees
parameters.name: Angle

parameters.description: Speed of the bullet, in pixels per second
parameters.name: Speed

eventsFunctions.description: Fire a single bullet. This is only meant to be used inside the "Fire bullet" action.
eventsFunctions.name: FireSingleBullet
eventsFunctions.sentence: Fire a single bullet _PARAM4_ from _PARAM0_, at position _PARAM2_; _PARAM3_, with angle _PARAM5_ and speed _PARAM6_ px/s

events.comment: Create bullet
Move bullet (apply angle and bullet speed variances)
Add identifier variables (to enable advanced picking by users)
Rotate newly created bullet, if needed
Update statistics

parameters.description: X position, where to create the bullet
parameters.name: XPosition

parameters.description: Y position, where to create the bullet
parameters.name: YPosition

parameters.description: Angle of the bullet, in degrees
parameters.name: Angle

parameters.description: Speed of the bullet, in pixels per second
parameters.name: Speed

eventsFunctions.name: BulletRotationEnabled

eventsFunctions.name: SetFiringArc

eventsFunctions.sentence: Set bullet speed variance of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ pixels per second

eventsFunctions.name: SetUnlimitedAmmo

eventsFunctions.name: Cooldown

propertyDescriptors.label: Firing cooldown
propertyDescriptors.description: Objects cannot shoot while firing cooldown is active

propertyDescriptors.label: Firing arc
propertyDescriptors.description: Multi-Fire bullets will be evenly spaced inside the firing arc
propertyDescriptors.name: FiringArc

propertyDescriptors.description: Multi-Fire bullets will be evenly spaced inside the firing arc
propertyDescriptors.name: BulletQuantity

propertyDescriptors.name: RotateBullet

propertyDescriptors.label: Reloading duration
propertyDescriptors.description: Objects cannot shoot while reloading is in progress
propertyDescriptors.name: ReloadDuration

propertyDescriptors.label: Total shots fired
propertyDescriptors.description: Regardless of how many bullets are created, only 1 shot will be counted per frame
propertyDescriptors.name: TotalShotsFired

propertyDescriptors.label: Heat increase per shot (Range: 0 to 1)
propertyDescriptors.description: Object is overheated when Heat reaches 1
propertyDescriptors.name: HeatIncreasePerShot

propertyDescriptors.label: Overheat duration
propertyDescriptors.description: Object cannot shoot while overheat duration is active
propertyDescriptors.name: OverheatDuration

propertyDescriptors.label: Exponential cooling rate (per second)
propertyDescriptors.description: Happens faster when heat is high and slower when heat is low
propertyDescriptors.name: ExponentialCoolingRate

propertyDescriptors.label: Layer the bullets are created on
propertyDescriptors.name: BulletLayer

propertyDescriptors.label: Bullet speed variance
propertyDescriptors.description: Bullet speed will be adjusted by a random value within this range
propertyDescriptors.name: BulletSpeedVariance
